submerging the protein that you're using
and shallow poaching is typically used
with very thin pieces of protein or thin
pieces of fish like a thin filet of sole
something like that because what happens
is the poaching cooks the bottom half of
the fish and then the steam cooks the
other portion and usually with shallow
poaching you then take the liquid that
you're poaching in you reduce it down
and you use it as part of your sauce so
this technique today deep poaching is
used for thicker cuts whole fish chicken
breast things like that so our

fish

otherwise it'll break apart the fillets
so a way to test whether or not it's

or you can use a thin bladed knife like

you're just going to take the tip of the
knife and you're going to insert it into

pull it out and you should be able to
feel warmth on the tip of the knife and
that way you know that the fish is done
now if it's cold the fish is not done
and if it's way too hot well guess what
you screw it up and you have to start
